titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Karl H. Von Wiegand papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elena S. Danielson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-14T16:14-0700

change.item: Revised to include new box 85 created after Preservation work. - Paige Davenport
Moved first folder in Box 47 to Box 46 to incorporate a misfiled folder into Box 47 (Paige Davenport).
Added unitid and notation for glass slide in envelope T.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Karl H. Von Wiegand Papers)//EN" "vonwieg.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 83 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 43 envelopes, memorabilia

did.abstract: Correspondence, dispatches, writings, photographs, clippings, and printed matter relating to European diplomacy and German politics between the world wars, the Sino-Japanese War, the European Theater in World War II, the Cold War, the post-war Middle Eastern situation, and American foreign policy.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Karl H. Von Wiegand papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Immigrated with family to the United States, settled in Iowa
Manager, Western Division Office, Associated Press, San Francisco
Correspondent, United Press Foreign staff, Berlin
Interview with Admiral Tirpitz concerning German plans for submarine warfare
Interview with Pope Benedict XV concerning effort for peace
Passenger, Graf Zeppelin, first trans-Atlantic flight
Passenger, Graf Zeppelin, first flight around the world
Interview with Adolf Hitler concerning German view of the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, dispatches, writings, photographs, clippings, and printed matter relating to European diplomacy and German politics between the world wars, the Sino-Japanese War, the European Theater in World War II, the Cold War, the postwar Middle Eastern situation, and American foreign policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical data, memorabilia, personal records, and press reports relating to the career of Karl H. von Wiegand, arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: Cards, business and visiting, printed copies,
Identification, press cards, etc., printed and typescript copies,
Medical records, printed and typescript copies,
Press reports relating to von Wiegand's career

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and plans, printed and typescript copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Karl H. von Wiegand, arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presumably identical with Dr. B. and Dr. Becker. See also: Luise Engeler.

did.unittitle: Constantine, King of Greece [See: Greece, Press Bureau]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Also known as Charles L. Flick

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presumably identical with Hank, Henry, Henrico

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of news dispatches, newspaper and magazine articles, essays, notes, and autobiographical writings by Karl H. von Wiegand, as well as interviews conducted by him with political figures, arranged chronologically.

News dispatches from the L.S. Hindenburg,

"Hitler Foresees His End," Cosmopolitan, printed copies,
"Europe for the Europeans," by Adolf Hitler, answers prepared in English for interview with von Wiegand, typescript,

scopecontent.p: Drafts, notes, and background material, typescripts and holographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, essays, correspondence, clippings, and pamphlets, arranged alphabetically by subject. Includes papers of journalist Grace M. Drummond-Hay.

did.unittitle: Memorabilia and miscellaneous correspondence re Graf Zeppelin
Allen, Hugh, The Story of the Airship,
Berliner Illustrierte Zeitung, "Dar Graf Zeppelin Weltflug" (Around the world flight of the Graf Zeppelin),
Brandt, Rolf, "Mit Dr. Eckener nach America," Die Woche,
Bruer, Carl, Erste Fahrt des Luftschiffes Hindenburg nach Nordamerika und zurueck (First flight of the airship Hindenburg to America and back),
Dettmann, Mit dem "Zeppelin" nach America: Das Wunder von Himmel und Ozean (With the "Zeppelin" to America: The miracle of sky and ocean),
Geisenheyner, Max, Mit "Graf Zeppelin" um die Welt (with Graf Zeppelin around the world),
Goodyear Zeppelin Corporation, ZRS-4 Ring Laying: America in the Skyways,
Megias, Jeronimo, La primera vuelta al mundo en el "Graf Zeppelin" (The first flight of the Graf Zeppelin around the world),
Die Woche, "21 Tage Weltgeschichte" (21 days of world history),
Die Woche, "Zeppelin faehrt um die Welt" (Zeppelin travels around the world) (4),
Newspaper clippings re trans-Atlantic flight of the Graf Zeppelin,
Newspaper clippings re world flight of the Graf Zeppelin
Newspaper clippings re flight of the airship Hindenburg to the United States,
Pamphlets - The Sphere and Le Progres Egyptien
Der Adler, "Legion Condor an der Front,"
Dispatches by W. R. Hearst, Jr., from the Soviet Union,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 3,357 prints, 17 negatives, 1 glass negative, and 5 drawings, arranged by subject.

did.unittitle: Photograph albums (4) relating to World War I
6 prints, early portraits of von Wiegand,
99 prints, portraits and snapshots of von Wiegand,
362 prints relating to the airship Graf Zeppelin,
17 negatives of articles by von Wiegand,
51 prints, mainly portraits, including Count and Countess Courten, Gen. Bernhardi, Graf Brockderff-Rantzau, Wilhelm Werner, Samoilovich,
52 prints of W. R. Hearst, Marion Davies, and San Simeon,
15 prints of Rudolf Nebel working with experimental rockets,
Glass plate negative depicting Chiang Kai-shek and Soong May-ling on their wedding day,
16 prints depicting the Graf Zeppelin's round-the-world voyage,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One Middle Eastern sword, one Ethiopian sword, and one Ethiopian shield. Use copies of items available in Box 85.
